results.deck: Sheristan is a lost and forgotten city on the surface of Demetria. Once a place of wonders, it has been abandoned, and lies empty and ruined as it overlooks a lonely desert canyon.
results.name: Sheristan

results.description:
Physics Professor Martin Stein's dream was to create a fully automated, self-sustaining nuclear power plant. After years of hard work and dedication, he was about to achieve his lifelong goal. The night before the plant was to go online, a group of nuclear protesters broke in, planted dynamite, and knocked Stein unconscious before he could stop them. Unknown to him, his former assistant, Dr. Danton Black, was also in the Plant the night before its opening. His intentions were far from noble, however, as he was simply covering up the fact that he had been stealing Stein's designs for the Plant (though Martin had fired him upon firing out, Black was never turned in to the authorities, and he had accused Martin of stealing the plant designs from him). When the dynamite went off and exposed three men (Stein, Black, and a high school student caught up in the protest, Ronnie Raymond) to a wave of nuclear radiation, they were all instantly affected. Ronnie and Martin were fused together, creating the nuclear fusion-powered hero, Firestorm, the Nuclear Man; while Black was fissioned apart into multiple, slightly smaller, copies of himself, becoming Multiplex, the Multiple Villain.

Though Firestorm eventually repaired the Plant, it was never officially opened, due to the investigation into the events of that evening. Stein's dream was never fully realized, and he moved on to other projects, while Black went from being a petty thief and scientist to full-time super-villain. There was a subsequent adventure with Superman in which it was revealed that the plant had gained sentience through the disaster and was attempting to control Firestorm, but it is no longer clear if that story is within current continuity, due to Crisis on Infinite Earths.
results.deck: This is the place where the original Firestorm was created.
results.name: Hudson Nuclear Power Plant

results.description:
Crimson Dawn

Crimson Dawn is a world beyond the shadows of the world. Its theme is mostly based on ethnic Chinese culture. The buildings are apparently made up from metal. A place here called Ebony Vain contains the elixir. The elixir was guarded by a Proctor because of its extreme powers.

Crimson Dawn is well known for its capability to heal anyone even with superhuman abilities. However, it leaves a red mark near the eyes of those people who have been healed. The most notable character who was healed in Crimson Dawn was the X-Man, Psylocke who have been brought to be healed after being brutally attacked by Sabretooth leading to her coma.

Many centuries ago, this dimension was overrun by the barbarian Li-Tzu Ch’eng. A group of monks prayed that the kingdom would be spared the endless bloodshed, but the Ming dynasty ended anyway. Frustrated that their prayers hadn’t been answered, Xiandu and three of his friends, Ra’al, Barak and A’yin, went down the darkest road they would ever travel. In the pitch of night they were initiated into a covenant that promised to repel ’s oppressors. However Xiandu underestimated the might of the Crimson Dawn, and only learned that his friends had been corrupted by it in the night they killed him. In the instant his life ended, Barak, A’yin and Ra’al found themselves transformed into the Dragons of the Crimson Dawn. Xiandu’s spirit remained on Earth, wandering around to await their inevitable escape from the Crimson realm.


In the present day, Psylocke was almost fatally wounded when Sabretooth escaped from the mansion. As she hovered on the brink between life and death, happened to know of a magical elixir that could possibly restore her. He and Archangel went to ’s to find the Crimson Dawn, and Dr. Strange, sensing their intent, joined their quest, which brought them to a Chinese restaurant.

Over the following months it became quite clear that the experience changed Betsy more than on a skin-deep level. She grew much colder and distanced herself from her lover and their friends. Even when she manifested the ability to shadow-port, Psylocke didn’t bother much nor tell anyone, one day startling the X-Men by teleporting into the mansion without warning. Just like them, Betsy understood that something was amiss with her, but she couldn’t bring herself to talk with anyone about her concerns. When she found herself under attack by a group of Undercloaks, she managed to fight them off all on her own, and did keep the battle secret, not even telling despite the dark warriors having attacked her in his penthouse.

Around the same time, The Dragons of the Crimson Dawn managed to journey to the Wildways, another Magical dimension, the home of Spiral when not serving Mojo. They needed the woman to help then teleport to Earth, but when Spiral refused to aid them, she was threatened with torture that was even beyond her Body Shoppe’s capabilities and she reluctantly accepted to join them and received the mark of the Crimson Dawn. Actually Spiral thought she could outsmart the Dragons at one point, but the Crimson Dawn’s influence was too strong and she had no choice but to release them on Earth, namely in London, where they surprise attacked Captain Britain. They took him prisoner to their native, where they wanted to channel his powers into breaching the dimensional wall to the Crimson Dawn, thus enslaving Earth.

However, Spiral alerted Excalibur to the Dragons’ plan, and teleported the team. Another one trying to spoil the plan was Xiandu’s spirit, who told Meggan, the only one to sense him, of the importance of the location, as it was a nexus of power. The spirit revealed to Meggan that not only her abilities but also her love for Brain was needed to rescue him and stop the two worlds from merging into one. While the rest of Excalibur temporarily held the Dragons of the Crimson Dawn at bay, Meggan helped Brian redirect the power flow, releasing it safely into the atmosphere. While Brian survived, he was Captain no more, his powers gone. The Dragons left by melting into the shadows, vowing that one day they would succeed and rule Earth.

With the dimensional walls already weakened, another creature could break through from the Crimson Dawn, the demon Kuragari. He hunted down Tar, and magically wrested control over Tar’s servants from him, only proceeding to kill him to become the next Proctor of the Crimson Dawn. Gomurr found his old rival’s body, and gave him a decent burial. Knowing that Kuragari would come after Psylocke next, he tried to warn her and , but he happened to be too late. In the meantime, the two X-Men had once again been attacked by Undercloaks, this time leaving behind a strange ring. By the time Gomurr arrived, Betsy, somehow attracted to the piece of jewelry, was already wearing it on her finger, thus allowing Kuragari to abduct her to the Crimson Dawn realm.

Apparently one can not take from the elixir without giving something in return, and as Psylocke’s debt had never been paid, Kuragari now thought to force her into becoming his bride. She tried to resist as hard as she could, but by the time arrived, sent after her by Gomurr, Betsy had already been transformed into a shadow creature. While Betsy left with Kuragari, had to face an entire army of Undercloaks. Back on Earth, Tar’s spirit visited Gomurr, thanking him for the burial and explaining that their past years of enmity had only served one purpose – training lessons for Gomurr to become the rightful next Proctor.

Accepting the mantle passed on to him, Gomurr too crossed over to the Crimson Realm and helped . In order to release Betsy from the Dawn’s hold, sacrificed an unknown amount of his own life-force to pay the debt. Now free of Kuragari’s influence, Betsy’s darkened skin vanished and together they managed to drive Kuragari away. While the lovers returned home, Gomurr remained behind in his new home.


With Psylocke dead, it might seem that the X-Men will no longer be confronted with any threats originating from the Crimson Dawn, but there are in fact four other X-Men having some possible connection to the place and the Elixir. For one there is who sacrificed part of his own life-force and left it in the Ebony Vein. Next there is Jean Grey, who underwent a strange power-swap with Psylocke shortly before her death. Betsy’s shadowy astral form, for example, had been transferred to Jean, though instead of the Crimson Dawn mark, she wore a symbol over her eye. Since Betsy’s death, however, Jean was not shown in this form, so the power swap’s effects might have worn off. Then there is Rogue, who carries the psychic imprints of all people she ever absorbed, including Betsy’s. Last but not least, Wolverine’s backstory with Gomurr and how he learned of the Crimson Dawn has yet to be revealed.

Further changes awaited Psylocke, as when she found herself tricked by the Shadow King into creating a psionic energy wave that temporarily disabled all psionic abilities on a world-wide scale, she manifested another ability thanks to the Crimson Dawn. Actually the Shadow King had torn apart Betsy’s astral self, leaving her twisted and disfigured. Betsy, though, rebuild herself in a new black form and found that this shadow astral self was nearly impossible to be detected, eventually defeating the Shadow King.

Spiral’s status too has not been cleared up, possibly she was able to get rid of the Crimson Dawn’s influence in the meantime, however she has not appeared since. While there was a Spiral in Exiles #18-19, this could easily be an alternate reality version of her (despite Mojo’s claim of there only being one Mojoverse) or a time-traveling past self.
results.deck: A pocket realm existing beyond the shadows of the world, this is where Pyslocke gained her eye tattoo and ability to shadow-teleport.
results.name: Crimson Dawn

results.description:
It is located in Washington, DC and was designed by John Stewart & Wonder Woman.

he Hall of Justice was constructed by the Justice League of America following a year after the destruction of the previous Justice League Watchtower, and located in Washington, D.C. and in the same location as the JSA and All-Star Squadron original headquarters. The Hall was designed by John Stewart and Wonder Woman, and financed by Batman and built from scratch by Superman. The Hall was later appropriated by the United Nations as the headquarters for the new Justice League International. This causes public outrage, with many citizens taking offense to the idea of superheroes from foreign countries using an American landmark as their base of operations, and cause a few civilians to blow up the Hall while the JLI was away on a mission.

The Rogue's Morgue

As well as being the Earth-based headquarters of the Justice League, the Hall of Justice also holds the bodies of some of the most powerful villians they have ever faced. Entombed three stories below are the following:

  • Alexander Luthor
  • Baron Blitzkrieg

Young Justice

The Hall of Justice replaced the Secret Sanctuary as the headquarters of the Justice League. According to Speedy, it's merely a front for tourists, the true headquarters of the Justice League is a secret space station. When Aqualad, Kid Flash, Robin, and Speedy began their initiation into the League, they were given full access to the Hall's training facilities, galley, and library. Speedy declined the offer and set out as an independent adventurer. The remaining three initiates went on to form Young Justice.

results.description:
Diet Building is Japan’s legislature composed of two houses:

  • The house of representatives (467 seats)

  • The house of councillors (250 seats)

It was created by the emperor Meiji during the Meiji era in order to democratise the Nippon governmental system. It is placed in Tokyo on Kasumigaseki hill. It has a German style because it was draw by Austrian architects.

In the X/1999, Diet Building is the place where Hinoto lives and does her predictions.
results.name: Diet Building

results.description:
The Koya Mount is sacred since time out of mind. It was the priest Kukai who founded a shingon-shu shrine. It consists on an esoteric Buddhism where mandalas are interpreted. His successor Shinnen created a huge sanctuary with more particularly the Kongobuji Shrine.

More of 110 buildings composed nowadays the Koya Mount. There are more than 250 000 graves of nobles and samurais.

In the X/1999, Sorata Arisugawa is a monk from Kongobuji Shrine.
results.name: Koya Mount

results.description:
Mitsumine Shrine is placed in Chichibu on Mitsumine Mount which are in reality three mounts (Sahogaoka, Kumotori and Hakugan). This Shrine is consecrated to Shinto’s gods’ founders of Japan: Izanagi and Izanami. It became also the shrine of inugami.

In the X/1999, Yuzuriha Nekoi comes from Mitsumine Shrine.
results.name: Mitsumine Shrine

results.description:
This scholar establishment was created by the Imonoyama family in order to receive one day the Sacred Sword. It has the shape of a five-branch star in order to be a kekkai.

The Clamp School is composed of kindergarten, elementary school, middle school, senior high school, college, university and graduate school. But there is also a shopping center, restaurants, hospitals, a park, a zoo, a bank, a botanic garden, a cinema, a research laboratory, residences and so on. It is a city inside the city of Tokyo.

In the X/1999, Nokoru Imonoyama, Akira Iyuin and Suo Takamura are the directors of the Clamp School.
results.name: Clamp School

results.description:
The city hall of Tokyo is the major building in Shinjuku. This edifice is inspired by the French cathedral: Notre Dame de Paris. It is a 243-meter-height steel building built between 1988 and 1991.

In the X/1999, the city hall of Tokyo is the place where meet the Dragons of Earth.

Moreover, Yuto Kigai and Kanoe work for the municipality.
results.name: City Hall of Tokyo

results.description:
The Sunshine 60 tower is situated at Ikebukuro. Realized in 1978, this 226-meter-height building counts 60 floors. Inside the Sunshine 60, you can find a huge shopping center and enterprises’ offices. The last floor is a room where you can observe Tokyo.

In the X/1999, Tojyo Pharmaceutical has laboratories inside the Sunshine 60. Sunshine is also a kekkai.
results.name: Sunshine 60

results.description:
The Ise Shrine is the most popular and the most visited shrine of Japan. It is situated between Tokyo and Osaka, inside the prefecture of Mie. In fact there are two major shrines: Naiku and Geku. There are also thousands of little shrine.

Naiku shrine was created in 2 B.C. and was dedicated to the Shinto’s goddess Amaterasu, goddess of the Sun and mother of the imperial dynasty of Japan.

Geku shrine was created in the 4th century and was dedicated to the Shinto’s goddess Toyoke, goddess of agriculture and sericulture.

Naiku and Geku shrines are destroyed and rebuilt traditionally every twenty years. The next session will be in 2013.

In the X/1999, Arashi Kishu is the hidden miko of the Ise Shrine.
results.name: Ise Shrine

results.description:
Tokyo Tower is the most popular Japanese tower of observation. Built in 1958, the Tokyo Tower is inspired by the Eiffel Tower. This 343-meter tower weights 3,000 tons less than the Eiffel Tower. It has four floors composed of an aquarium, an observation gallery, a wax museum and an art gallery.

In the X/1999, the Tokyo Tower is the ultimate kekkai.
results.name: Tokyo Tower

results.description:
The yamanote line is a part of Tokyo railroad. This line has a shape of a circle of 34.5 kilometres, 28 stations like Shibuya, Harajuku, Shinjuku, Ikebukuro, Ueno, Akihabara or Shimbashi.

In the X/1999, the Yamanote line is a kekkai with the shape of a Buddha’s hand created by Karen Kasumi.
results.name: Yamanote Line

results.description: The Togakushi Shrine is a fictive shrine created in the X/1999. Togakushi Shrine means “the shrine of the hidden sword”. Indeed the Sacred Sword is kept there until the “Jour de la Promesse”. The priest of this shrine is Kyogo Mono.
results.name: Togakushi Shrine

results.description:
A soapland is an establishment in Shinjuku, the Tokyo’s Soho. Men are going there in order to take a bath with gorgeous young women. These women do after the bath a massage and some other sensual stuff. The employees must be in sexy underwear.

They aren’t prostitutes. They don’t sleep with their clients. They are a kind of geishas in the industry of sex. They are well protected. If a client tries to go too far, the security throws him outside in the following minute.

Soaplands were created when the prostitution was been forbidden. Brothels became soaplands.

In the X/1999, Karen Kasumi works in a soapland.
results.name: soaplands of Shinjuku

results.deck: Menzoberranzan is one of the largest, if not the largest city of drow in the Underdark of Faerun. Drizzt Do'urden is perhaps the most well known citizen of the city to the surface world.
results.name: Menzoberranzan

results.description: It consists of Sorcere for wizards, Arach-Tinith for priestesses of Lolth, and Melee-Magthere for drow warriors.
results.deck: The Academy is the main training school through which all drow of Menzoberranzan pass.
results.name: The Academy

results.description:
The research facility was founded by Moira MacTaggert as she created it for her destructively powerful mutant son, Proteus. The knowledge contained in this facility includes the knowledge of many mutants and their abilities as well as mutant-related concerns.

It was here that Professor X stored information on how to kill members of the X-Men, if the need ever arose and it has been a base of the X-Men team, Excalibur. It is also where Magneto and Spoor were imprisoned.

Members of its staff have included Rahne Sinclair, Rory Campbell, Tom Corsi, Sharon Friedlander and James Madrox. It has also been seen as a target for many including the Acolytes, Shadow King, Galactus, the MLF, Spiral, Bastion, Legion and Proteus.

The facility was destroyed by a Shadow King-possessed Legion and after it was rebuilt it was once again destroyed, this time by Mystique and Sabretooth.

Earth-1610: In the Ultimate Marvel Universe, Muir Island's facility is still led by Moira MacTaggert but it is a hospital for mutants rather than a research facility.

results.description:
The Microverse, or Sub-Atomica, is a universe not unlike our own just on a much smaller scale. Located within our own universe, a trip to the Microverse requires shrinking down to a minuscule size.  
 
The Microverse is sustained by the Enigma Force, a living essence that is actually the Microverse itself. 

Inhabitants

The Microverse is home to some of the most unique characters in The Marvel Universe. Characters who are loved and cherished by fans all across the world. The Microverse has also been visited by many of Marvel's heavy hitters and has been the setting for many great storylines. Below is a list of inhabitants who have been key players in many different stories:

results.description:
History

Sliding Albion was discovered in the 1920's. The main (but certainly not the only) difference between Sliding Albion and the normal Wildstorm Universe Earth is that first contact with an alien species on Sliding Albion was overt. In the default WSU Earth, the two instances of major alien contact (the Kherubim/Daemonite War and the future-sapiens/aliens that modified Jack Hawksmoor) were both covert. Not only was alien contact on Sliding Albion overt, it was the meeting of two "expansionist renaissance courtly cultures." Even though the aliens were much more advanced than the humans, the two races got along very well. So well in fact, that the humanoid aliens bred with human European royalty. This was even more significant because the year in Sliding Albion at the time of alien contact was 1500. By the early twentieth century, the new, merged culture, was a stagnant imperialist society, and it was looking for war. The people of Sliding Albion discovered how to travel The Bleed, the interdimensional highway, and went looking for new Earths to take over. The effort wasn't a strong one, the people were more bored than power hungry. When they came into contact with the main Wildstorm Earth, the fighting stopped quickly and there was a period of peace and cultural exchange. However, in 1953, a world war started that apparently destroyed Sliding Albion.
results.deck: Sliding Albion is an alternate Earth in the Wildstorm Universe.
results.name: Sliding Albion

results.description:
Above the Spine of the World mountain range in the northwestern corner of Faerun lies the wide valley known as Icewind Dale. Originally settled by rogues with no where else to go centuries before, the Dale now boasted ten villages, collectively known as Ten-Towns. Each of the ten villages made their livelihood through fishing for the knucklehead trout which lived in abundance in the several lakes of the Dale. Good for food, the knucklehead troat was also the sole source of bone for the Dale's other well-known export, scrimshaw.

Dominating the landscape of the Dale is the sole mountain in the grand valley, a craggy peak known as Kelvin's Cairn. Many of the ten villages had been built with their back to the mountain, allowing it to form a natural barrier between the individual settlements, and forming a last resort of defense from the orc and giant hoards found in the northern reaches. Down below the mass of Kelvin's Cairn, lies another unseen settlement, unknown to the casual observer. The Battlehammer clan of dwarves, in exile from their traditional home of Mithril Hall.
results.deck: In the forbidding northwestern reaches of Faerun lies Icewind Dale. Lying north of the Spine of the World mountain range, they are the last bastion of civilization on the surface world.
results.name: Icewind Dale

results.description:
Overview:

Attilan is the ancestral home of the Inhumans, a highly advanced offshoot of the human race. About seven thousand years ago, the Inhumans grew tired of centuries of persecution by their more primitive parent race, and decided to create a place of refuge for themselves. Under the leadership of King Myran, the Inhumans chose as a site for their city a small island in the northern Atlantic Ocean, located about two hundred miles southwest of Iceland. The city, which took several decades to complete, was named Attilan, a name derived from Atlantis, the former pinnacle of civilization on Earth that had vanished beneath the sea about three millennia before. Attilan has been the sole center of the Inhuman population ever since.

For millennia, the Inhumans dwelt in Attilan, isolated from contact with mainstream humanity except for an occasional encounter with a lost Greek or Viking sailing vessel. Finally, in the mid-Twentieth Century, with the advent of steamships and airplanes, the Inhumans began to fear discovery by the human race. When one of his subjects was captured by human beings, young king Black Bolt determined that the Inhumans must move their civilization to some place more secure. Employing anti-gravity generators, the Inhumans moved their entire city and its foundation in one piece. The new site of Attilan, a hidden valley in the Himalayan Mountain range in China, was excavated by the Eternals, another variant offshoot of humanity. The Himalayan site of Attilan became known as "the Great Refuge." The Himalayas did not prove to be remote enough to enable the Inhumans to retain their secrecy, however, and soon the Inhumans' existence became known to several of the governments of the outside world, although not to the general public. While in the Himalayas, all of Attilan's ancient architecture was accidentally destroyed by Black Bolt and the city has been extensively redesigned and rebuilt.

Since Earth air is deadly to the Inhumans when Attilan was on Earth it had protective barriers. It had five separate defensive systems. A trillion-volt palisade, a progressive eco-filter to scrub the rancid air. And a dome of impenetrable negative space surrounding it all. Attilan was relocated once again, this time to escape the effects of Earthly pollution and disease. Attilan is currently located in the Blue Area of the Moon, nestled in the ruins of an ancient city built by the alien Kree whose technology gives the Blue Area its own artificially created atmosphere.

Attilan defenses are very powerful. It has been able to travel outside of Earth in space without being damaged. It has also been able to take an attack of cannons and bombs. Th e shield would evaporate the bombs and just absorb the energy, making it stronger on every attack. There was a machine that Maximus built that would disrupt the shield and cause it to fall. With this and lightning the shield of Attilan would fall. Even though the shield is very strong it has been compromised by the Kree and the Skrulls.

Outside of Attilan is a junkyard of Shi'ar technology that the Inhumans do not use. This space is used as a playground for curious Inhuman children. Underneath the city of Attilan lies the Alpha Primitives, and the technology that keeps Attilan working. This is a basement like structure full of machines that the Alpha Primitives call mother.
 
After the Inhumans took over leadership of the Kree Empire, Attilan was moved to Hala, the capital of the empire.

Features:

Attilan is far more technologically advanced than other cities of its era. The Inhumans have used their technology to relocate the city and the island upon which it is built to other locations, even taking it off of the planet itself.
 
Video Games
 
Attilan appears as a base in the video-game Marvel: Ultimate Alliance when the heroes are saved from Doom by the Watcher.
results.deck: Attilan is the city of the Inhumans and is currently located on the Capital World of the Kree Empire, Hala.
results.name: Attilan

results.deck: Project Entry Earth is an alternate universe's Earth that is accessible through the Project Entry teleportation system.
results.name: Project Entry Earth

results.deck: Cryshal-Tirith is a crystalline tower created in the image of, and by the Crystal Shard, Crenshinibon. It exists wherever the Shard is, can replicate itself, but it grows less powerful with each copy.
results.name: Cryshal-Tirith

results.description:
Project: P.E.G.A.S.U.S. "Potential Energy Group/Alternate Sources/United States" was founded with the idea of researching alternate forms of renewable energy, but has also been used as a prison for super-powered individuals. The location of this facility is described as being in the Adirondack Mountains in New York State. Headed by Dr. Myron Wilburn, it quickly found itself at the center of much unwanted attention when the structure came to house a Cosmic Cube, a Nth Projector, and the Serpent Crown and several other artifacts of great power. Soon the Project also began testing on metahuman specimens, mostly career criminals, but others, such as Aquarian and Dazzler were also tested extensively, yet humanely. The Project became little better than a prison to many of the specimens such as, Klaw, Solaar, and Nuklo, and as such they sought escape.

Shortly after the project's completion, Quasar was offered the position of Head of Security, based on his service record with the army, SHIELD, and a recommendation from Captain America. He served in this role admirably for several months, with the Thing's help he, along with Thundra, Goliath, and Aquarian saved the world and potentially the universe from Dr. Thomas Lightner, who had turned himself into a living singularity, calling himself the Nth Man.

Months later, the entire Project was taken over by the Serpent Crown. Only the intervention of several outsiders averted a complete disaster. Quasar blamed himself and tendered his resignation. He was soon replaced by Blue Shield, who held the position for several years was just recently replaced by Darkhawk. When the Squadron Supreme were exiled from their universe by Dr. Lightner, they made the Project their temporary home.

Quasar returned briefly to save the Project from the sentient alien armor that Iron Man brought back with him from Battleworld (Secret Wars II) as it attempted to consume the entire Project. Quasar managed to fly it down the magma tap which destroyed it.

During Secret Invasion, the project was inveded by a cadre of Skrulls who recognized the threat that PEGASUS meant to their invasion since there were devices held at Project PEGASUS was could litterally burn the Skrull fleet out of the sky. Security Chief Darkhawk and Nova the last member of the Nova Corps, along with the remaining Guardsmen managed to defend the Project valiantly along with the help a newly reborn Quasar.
results.deck: Project: PEGASUS is an alternate energy/research and development facility located in New York state. It also served for a time as a prison for energy manipulating metahumans.
results.name: Project: P.E.G.A.S.U.S.

results.description:
It was at Christ's Crown where at the moment of Blackheart's birth, he desires to kill his father.  It is all where rounds up Ghost Rider, Punisher, and Wolverine in hopes to join him to fight his father.  After battling Blackheart on Christ's Crown, the threw heros took the battle to Hell where Blackheart meet defeat.

Christ's Crown got its name from the gigantic forest of thorn bushes covering the forest area of the town. Also symbolising the crown of thorns worn by Jesus.  It is also the home of a girl named Lucy who Blackheart kidnapped to get the attention of Ghost Rider, Punisher, and Wolverine and also said was the only uncorrupted soul in the town.
results.deck: Christ's Crown is where the demon son of Mephisto, Blackheart was born. Years of murder in this locale was the perfect place for Mephisto to draw upon the accumulated evil from and have a son
results.name: Christ's Crown

results.description: Main location of everything that happened in Cowboy Bebop. Ganymede is a moon that was formed into a livable place after the war that led to the creation of the gate system.
results.deck: One of the Gallilean moons of Jupiter.
results.name: Ganymede

results.description:
The Quantum-Zone appears as a featureless pale yellow or white expanse that seems to stretch on forever but in reality is approximately as large and expansive as the universe. It has been postulated that the Quantum-Zone contains all the potential energy in the universe.

The Quantum Bands enable the bearer to “quantum jump” or create apertures between the fabric of space/time of various sizes. Allowing the wearer access to the Quantum zone. A wearer can then travel through this trackless, featureless zone and emerge at a different point in our physical space light years away from his starting point only seconds later. The bands would enable the wearer to keep his bearings while in the zone and thus emerge where he wants to. Important note, however, the bearer cannot access the Quantum-Zone within an atmosphere without ripping a hole in its ozone layer.

The Zone is approximately as expansive as our own universe and is known to be somehow related to the cosmic entity Infinity who is the manifestation of all space in the universe. She has manifested within the Quantum-Zone on more than one occasion.

Quasar has often been known to use the Q-Zone tactically, where he has Quantum-jumped out of harms way or used the zone itself as a prison for truly dangerous opponents, such as The Presence or accidentally in the case of Neutron of the Imperial Guard. When Thanos created duplicates of several previous bearers of the Quantum bands to attack Quasar, he used the background “noise” of the Zone to mask his intentions of feeding the doppelgangers too much power, overloading them.

When Maelstrom wielded the bands, he postulated that they were only slightly less powerful than the Infinity Gauntlet given that the bands are backed by the limitless potential of the Quantum zone.

It is not known if the Quantum-Zone is a side-effect of the creation of the Quantum-bands or if the Quantum-bands were created to harness the potential energy of the Quantum-Zone.

In the 31st century an Inhumans was rumored to be capable of creating wormholes through the Quantum-Zone to travel wherever he needed to go.
results.deck: The Quantum-Zone is the dimension of limitless potential energy that interfaces with and powers the Quantum bands.
results.name: Quantum-Zone

results.deck: The fictional city featured in the DC and IDW volumes of "Fallen Angel".  Similar to New Orleans in atmosphere, it is host to many unique locales and buildings.
results.name: Bete Noire

results.description:
The Church of Eternal Life was founded by the master vampire, Malcolm, who is still the head of the church. It is located just off Page Avenue, in St. Louis, Missouri.

The church itself is located far from the "vampire district" of St. Louis. The building is rather generic and contains no religious symbols for the safety of the vampire part of the congregation. Members must be at least 18 years old to join and include both humans and vampires. They have sermons and sing songs just like most churches, but their beliefs are based on vampirism and how some humans are drawn to the vampire lifestyle.

During the day, members try to convert willing humans to join the church with the promise that they will gain immortality. Some of the humans just like the church and its beliefs, but have intention of joining the ranks of the undead. Sermons are held after the sun sets so the vampire members can listen. Coffee and blood are offered to the members after the service.

The daytime secretary is a human named Bruce, who schedules Malcolm's appointments while he's in his coffin.

Enemies of the church include H.A.V. (Humans Against Vampires), and the Catholic Church.
results.deck: An organization founded by the master vampire Malcolm; famous for promising to convert the human members into vampires one day.
results.name: Church of Eternal Life

results.description:
Founded by Bert Vaughn, Animators Inc. is the only zombie-raising firm in the Midwest. It is located in St. Louis, Missouri. It started out in a spare room above a garage, but moved a few years later to an office building shared with a real estate company, lawyers, a marriage counselor, psychologists, and plastic surgeons. The firm consists of a reception room and three offices. Bert thought homey, calm feel for the clients, so the wallpaper in the office is pale green (reception) and blue (offices). Bert chose the smallest office for himself and the other two offices are shared between the four animators:

Anita Blake: Most powerful of the animators. She can raise 100+ year old zombies (rare talent), so Bert lets her have most of the publicity for the company. She is also a legal vampire hunter, hence the nickname "The Executioner".

Manny Rodriguez: A retired vampire hunter, Manny trained Anita to raise zombies and hunt vampires. Manny was almost killed by a vampire a few years ago, so his wife, Rosita, convinced him to stop hunting vampires for the sake of his life and his family.

Jamison Clarke: Jamison is very much so pro-vampire and tends to butt heads with Anita a lot.

Charles (last name unknown): Charles is a little squeamish when it comes to raising zombies, but does his job well and takes care of his four year old child.

The fee for raising a zombie depends on its age. A standard fee is somewhere around $3,000, but Bert makes his clients pay dearly for very old zombies. A 100 year old zombie would cost someone around $20,000 to have raised. Most corpses are raised for court purposes, mainly witnesses who died before they could testify. People also sometimes have a loved one raised so they can say their good-byes if they didn't get the chance.

Animators Inc. has two secretaries:

Mary: A fifty-something grandmother, who Anita swears uses a can of hairspray to keep her hair in place. Mary works the day shift.

Craig: Craig is the night-time secretary.
results.deck: St. Louis-based zombie raising firm where famous animator Anita Blake works.
results.name: Animators Inc.

results.description:
Dead Dave's was opened a few years ago by an ex-police officer named Dave. He was kicked off the local St. Louis police force when they found out he was a vampire. Dave and his staff hear a lot of gossip about the local vampires since the bar is located in The District. He still wants to help the police by telling them any information he hears that might be of importance to them, but he resents the fact that they kicked him off the force just because he was dead. So he enlisted the help of RPIT's preternatural civilian expert, Anita Blake. He tells her valuable information and she tells the police; this way Dave won't have to deal with his old prejudiced friends. Dave only asked that Anita never shared the information with anyone but the police and pretended she was a customer. She would always order a glass of orange juice and they would pretend it was a Screwdriver.

Dave: Dave is the owner and nighttime manager. His bar is his home.

Luther: While Dave is dead for the day, Luther, the bartender and daytime manager is in charge and often talks to Anita and helps her with any news he's heard.
results.deck: A vampire-owned bar located in The District of St. Louis, Missouri.
results.name: Dead Dave's

results.description:
Owned and operated by local master vampire, Jean-Claude, Guilty Pleasures is famous for being the only vampire strip club in the world. Not all of the dancers are vampires, but some of the employees are. Some of the acts involve willing employees and customers playing along to make the audience's vampire fantasies come true. Jean-Claude MC's the acts and sometimes rolls the minds of the audience, by using his vampire mind tricks, so people seem to just appear on the stage or feel like they've been touched or kissed when no one did.

Since Guilty Pleasures involves lots of vampires, it made sense to have a holy-item check at the front of the club. All crosses, rosaries, and other holy items must be checked-in upon entry for the safety of the vampires inside the club.

Other known employees are:

  • Aubrey: dancer, vampire

  • Robert: dancer, vampire

  • Phillip: dancer, human

  • Buzz: bouncer, vampire
results.deck: The vampire owned and operated all-male strip club located in The District of St. Louis, Missouri.
results.name: Guilty Pleasures

results.description:
The Circus of the Damned is located on the edges of The District in St. Louis, Missouri. It is a year-round carnival located inside a giant warehouse. New visitors to the Circus would realize quickly that this carnival is unlike any other they've ever been to. Giant neon lights spell out the carnival's name surrounded by giant fanged clowns. Various old-fashioned banners hang from the exterior of the Circus, advertising their many horrifying attractions.

The inside of the Circus is much like any other carnival except it's inside an old warehouse. However, this warehouse is so huge that visitors can ride the full-sized ferris wheel off to one side. Vendors sell corn dogs, cotton candy, and other mid-way treats. Visitors can play one of the many games and win a cuddly but slightly frightening toy such as fanged bats, snakes, panthers, and child-sized teddy bears. Other regular attractions include a funhouse with clowns and a haunted house.

Tents off to the sides attract many people, including children, to one of the more interesting shows. At the Circus, you can see a werewolf shift into his beast, see a zombie be raised from a grave, or even watch Count Alcourt be repeatedly hanged.

SPOILERS AHEAD

  • Please stop reading now if you haven't already read the book!

Known by few, The Circus of the Damned is the day-time resting place for the Master of the City, Nikolaos, and some of her most trusted Vampires. Beneath the Circus is a set of stairs with steps almost too large for a human and also too wide... like the stairway was built for something else. Something larger. Nikolaos has a throne room and a dungeon. There is a labyrinth of tunnels under the Circus that lead to the dungeon known only to the Wererats.
results.deck: A horrific carnival housed in an old warehouse on the edge of The District that attracts many people and families.
results.name: The Circus of the Damned

results.description:
Formerly known as The Riverfront, The District is one of the hottest areas in St. Louis. It is where all the vampire-owned and operated business are located. (Except the Church of Eternal Life, which was purposely built far away from The District.) It is located just off of I-70 and covers an area many blocks, in an older part of the city. The streets are narrow and were designed for horses.. not cars. That's one reason people believe the vampires chose the area.

The District is made up of mostly nighttime businesses only. Finding a parking space in the daytime is easy but at night.. you might have to walk several blocks to get to one of the clubs.

Known businesses in The District:

  • The Circus of the Damned

  • Dead Dave's

  • Guilty Pleasures

People who disapprove of The District have nicknamed it "Blood Square". It is also where most human and vampire interaction happens.
results.deck: The area where the vampire-owned businesses are located in St. Louis, Missouri.
results.name: The District

results.description:
The Winchesters lived in Lawrence, Kansas and it's the only real city they can call home even though they had to abandon their roots. John and Mary were married and had two sons, Sam and Dean. When Sam was only six-months-old an intruder entered his nursery. Mary went to check on Sam and she was confronted and killed by a yellow-eyed demon in their quaint suburban home. Lawrence, Kansas doesn't seem to be a particular "hot spot" for demon/magical activity, but it's more likely that the demon specifically wanted Sam no matter where he lived at the time.

Also residing in the city is Missouri Mosley who aids John Winchester in his new demon-hunting lifestyle.
results.deck: from "Supernatural: Origins". Hometown of the Winchester family.
results.name: Lawrence, Kansas

results.description:
Eureka, California is a real city located 40.79° North, 124.15° West.

In "Supernatural: Origins," John Winchester travels to this city at the very beginning of his demon hunting. He locates a cemetery on Route 101 where he encounters a type of hellhound called a Black Shuck.
results.deck: A real city which appears in Wildstorm's "Supernatural: Origins" comic spinoff of the TV show.
results.name: Eureka, California

results.description:
Introduction

The Leaf village is the most powerful and prosperous of the five great ninja villages and has had a long history of great leaders that they honor with a Mt. Rushmore-like cliff-side, with a carving of each of the Hokage's faces on it.
It was here that Naruto Uzumaki was born, also known as the Nine Tailed Fox's recipient, a "host" if you will. It is also the birthplace of many of the Naruto series' main characters, such as Sasuke Uchiha, Itachi Uchiha, Kakashi Hatake, and Sakura Haruno.

WARNING:
The following article may or may not contain spoilers, depending on whether or not you have read the Japanese Naruto, which, like most manga, is far ahead of where we are in America. This article is based off of strictly what is happening in the manga at this time and what has already happened, not the english anime, and therefore may contain spoilers for readers who have not kept up with the Japanese manga.

Creation

Konohagakure, also known as Konoha, The Village Hidden in the Leaves, and the Leaf Village, was formed by its First Leader, aka its Hokage , by himself. The First Hokage was renowned for his extreme ability to manipulate wood and other jutsu, was of course dubbed as the greatest ninja of Konoha.


The First and Second Hokage

He was singlehandedly able to form the Leaf village, and, it was no less amazing that this formation took place with a single jutsu done in nearly minutes. The first Hokage's name was Shodai, and that is all that is known of him, or all that has thus been revealed in the Naruto universe. However, he is obviously not the one who formed it's Mount Rushmore like stone carvings, as they include multiple other Hokage in it, some far after his time. It is a fairly large city to be called a village, and has a number of places in which people go to just to have fun, like Ramen shops and parks. For a series with characters so dark and mysterious, you'd think that the city would be a bit more protected and less bright and happy, with children running around and having fun all of the time, like the Third Hokage's grandson. The village contains many shops and stores, as well as places just to sight see. Konoha is, has been, and more than likely will continue to be the most friendly of the ninja villages in the Narutoverse.

Leaders

So far, Konoha has had five leaders, also known as its Hokage. The word Hokage means "Fire Shadow", and is given to them as they are the biggest village in the fire nation, with the most power and influence. It should also be noted that the leaders of other villages are not called Hokage, but something else, like the Sand Villages Kazekage, given to it as it the largest village in the Land of Wind, of course meaning "Wind Shadow", the pattern is quite noticeable. The Five Hokage leaders have done as much as they could to help their village in times of need, and so far, their attempts have obviously worked. For more information on them, please visit the Hokage page. Here will simply give you a brief explanation of what they've done and the slightly complex history of the third and fourth.

The First Hokage

was from the Senju Clan of the forest, and was apparently able to use his wood based jutsu very skillfully. He, as mentioned before, singlehandedly made the Konoha that we know today.

The Second Hokage

was an intense water based jutsu user, and not much is known about him, other than that he was able to create and manipulate water by pulling it from the atmosphere.

The Third Hokage

was dubbed "The Professor" by his fellow shinobi due to his massive knowledge of techniques and how to use them. He was the oldest living of the Hokage, and was killed by Orochimaru. In the beginning of Naruto, he was the Hokage, though they consistently talked about what great things the Fourth Hokage had done. The reason that there was no fifth was because they had no good candidates, and the Third Hokage was willing to come out of his retirement to help the people of Leaf.
The Fourth Hokage is possibly the most well recognized by the media for being Hokage. He is a Naruto icon that entails one of the series' favorite themes, Sacrafice. The Fourht Hokage, as explained early in the series, was the one that went toe to toe with The Nine Tailed Fox, defeating it by using the jutsu that the Third Hokage used later in the series on Orochimaru, but, was only able to seal it into his son, Naruto Uzumaki.
The Fifth Hokage, Tsunade, is also a Naruto icon, mainly based on her developed physical stature and for her position as the toughest of the Naruto female cast. She is hemophobic (afraid of blood) due to her boyfriend's bloody death that she was unable to prevent. Tsunade is a practitioner of the healing arts and an extremely able fighter. She was also one of the three Sannin.

Major Events

These are not all of the major events in chronological order, they will be explained as they were in the manga. Meaning, though the Uchiha Massacre occurred before the Chuunin Exams, it will be explained afterwards as it was explained afterwards in the manga. This is, in some extent, chronological, but only to the manga timeline, not the story within itself.

Konoha is famous for having the strongest Shinobi Village military, and for being a major trade center in the land of fire. The main characters in Naruto are almost all denizens of Konoha, and many of the major events in the Narutoverse happen within the Leaf Village. Of the main story, the most important regarding Naruto would be the incident of the Nine Tailed Fox, in which Madara Uchiha, aka Tobi


Tobi, aka Madara Uchiha

of the Akatsuki, lead an attack against the village. As mentioned in the leaders section, the beats was run down and defeated by the Yondaime (aka The Fourth Hokage, Minato Namikaze) and sealed into Naruto, for reasons still unknown. This of course killed The Fourth, and caused the Third to come out of retirement. This is why he was still the man in control of the legendary village at the start and they still spoke of the Fourth, as if it were not for this then the chronological order would be out of whack.

Chuunin Exams

The first major even to happen within Konoha itself for the entire series was the Chuunin Exams, an event that had multiple villages send in their Genin for a test to see which were worthy of attaining the next rank in ninja hood. This arc introduced most of the main cast, actually, for all of Part I in the manga. It introduced characters like Gaara, Hinata, Shino, Kiba, Orochimaru, Kabuto, Kurenai, Jiraiya, Ino, Shikamaru, Lee, Guy, and of course a majority of the characters affiliated with those said. In the Chuunin Exams every major and basically secondary character showed up for part I, and basically they did what a majority of manga characters do, fight and look cool while doing it. At first, Naruto and his team might not have been able to even participate in the exams, as Sakura didn't think she could do it. Well, in the end, though she did decide to go for it anyways, it didn't quite matter as the team would only be trying to help each other out for one of the three tests, the rest of them they were on their own for the most part.
results.deck: Konohagakure means "The Village Hidden in the Leaves." It is the village of many of the Naruto character's births, and a major area in the Naruto world reknowned for its military might.
results.name: Konohagakure

results.description: A powerful nation feared across many a galaxy, the Z'nrx live on snarkworld. Every so long, there are wars to determine who the next emperor or empress is. Power Pack have often been brought here so that the snark queen maraud could steal their powers, but they have managed to get away with their powers. Recently, the world went into civil war.
results.deck: The place where the Z'nx/Snarks, Power Packs enemies live.
results.name: Snarkworld

results.description:
Stamford, a small city in Connecticut, was destroyed by a battle between the New Warriors, and Nitro, Coldheart, Cobalt Man, and Speedfreek. The New Warriors fought this group in hopes of increasing ratings on their TV show. What they didn't expect, though, was a tragedy. Nitro set off an explostion that left the city in rubble. This caused the government to question the values of some superheroes, and in the public's best interest, unveiled the Super-Human Registration Act. Objection to this act was the cause of the Civil War.

Stamford is the home of Camp Hammond, the superhuman training facility and HQ of the Initiative.
results.deck: The start of the civil war. Stamford CT was a city, which was obliviated by the mutant, Nitro. He was provoked by Namorita, initiating the Super-human Registration Act. This was the devastating reason for the civil war, which caused great aggravation for the planet Earth.
results.name: Stamford, CT

results.description: In Wildstorm's [[Supernatural: Origins:vol:18794]], Harvelle's Roadhouse is a saloon where demon hunters gather to rest and share information. The bar is run by Ellen and Bill Harvelle who have a daughter Jo. Ellen and Jo appear in the TV series but by then Bill is already dead. The exact location of The Roadhouse is not yet known. Fan speculations believe it to be somewhere in Nebraska.
results.deck: Bar where demon hunters hangout in Supernatural series.
results.name: Harvelle's Roadhouse

results.description:
Appearance

The Lost Land usually appears as a lush and thick jungle or tropical forest. The Lost Land contains a myriad of different environment ranging from mountain ranges and underground caves to plains and highlands.

Creatures

The Lost Land is home to a plethora of creatures ranging from average, yet primitive, humans to all sorts of monsters as well as everything in between. One of the most common group of creatures whose home is the lost land are all different varieties of dinosaurs that include Raptors, T-Rexs, and many others. Many of the creatures in the lost land have been genetically of technologically enhanced to increase their ferocity and killing ability.

Mothergod

The cosmic being Mothergod is responsible for the technological and genetic upgrades made to the beings of the lost land.

Turok

Turok has had many ventures in The Lost Land battling it's monsters as well as the Mothergod.
results.deck:
Location that appears in the world of Turok, Dinosaur Hunter (Valiant Comics). The Lost Land is sealed off from time and inhabited by a myriad of creatures including technologically enhanced dinosaurs (bionisaurs) and other monsters.  
Turok Son Of Stone (Dell, Gold Key, Whitman) called it "Lost Valley".
results.name: The Lost Land

results.description:
Multiverse

Representation Of The Multiverse.

The Marvel Multiverse is the collection of separate universes, or realities that all Marvel Comics takes place in. There is possibly an infinite number of different realities, some of which is located outside the Multiverse, but still has an earth-designation. An example of this is Earth-14861, the New Universe.

The various realities are always called Earth-[number], despite referring to the whole reality, not just the earth. It is also, but less frequently, called Reality-[number].

The Multiverse was originally established as being protected by Merlyn, and later by Saturnyne and the [Captain Britain] Corps. There are other beings and groups dealing with protecting the Multiverse, for example the Time Variance Authority, the Exiles and A.R.M.O.R.

Most realities has a Captain Britain designated to protect its version of the British Isles and in extension the reality. These protectors are collectively known as the Corps.

New realities are constantly created and often involves time traveling characters as time travel in Marvel comics always creates divergent realities, and it is not possible to alter time or travel back to your own past.

Omniverse

The term Omniverse refers to all Marvel realities as well as every other fictional universe or reality ever created.

Earth-616

The main continuity in which most Marvel storylines take place was designated Earth-616. The term Earth-616 was first used by Alan Moore in his run of the Marvel UK comic Captain Britain.Fans originally thought that the number 616 was a reference of the release date of the first Fantastic Four comic. However Alan Moore when asked about it said that 616 was just a random number of no significance chosen because people always seemed to be talking about 'earth 2' or 'earth 4' but never any higher numbers. See here for reference.

Significant storylines and their realities

  • 1602 - Earth-311
  • Age of Apocalypse - Earth-295
  • Days of Future Past - Earth-811
  • Earth X - Earth-9997
  • House of M - Earth-58163
  • Mangaverse - Earth-2301
  • Marvel Zombies - Earth-2149
  • MC2 - Earth-982
  • Mutant X - Earth 1298
  • Ultimate Universe - Earth-1610

Alternate realities

Earth-0000/Earth Prime

A.R.M.O.R. gave this designation to reality, the non-fictional world in which Marvel Comics is a company and all of the other worlds are comic books written by them. This Earth is the keystone from which all other realities originate.

  • First appearance of reality: Fantastic Four #511

Earth-9

Earth-9 is the reality from which Saturnyne hails, she is important as she is the Omniversal Majestrix and an ally of Captain Britain. Some of her famed counterparts include Courtney Ross (Earth-616) and Sat-Yr-9 (Earth-839).

  • First appearance of reality: Marvel Superheroes #380
  • First got an Earth designation in: Mighty World of Marvel #13

Earth-12

Mimic of Earth-12

The home reality of Mimic from Exiles

  • First appearance of reality: Exiles #1
  • First got an Earth designation in: Exiles #83

Earth-15

Earth-691

Earth-691 Guardians of the Galaxy

First appearance of reality: Marvel Super-Heroes V.2 #18

First got an Earth designation in: Marvel Encyclopedia: Fantastic Four (Alternate Earths appendix)

Often referred to as the War of the Worlds reality, Earth-691 branched off from the standard 616 reality towards the turn of the 21st century. At that time, Martians invaded the Earth and won, killing most of Earth's heroes. The Earth in shambles, the entire Solar System would be invaded and taken over by the Badoon in the 31st century, wiping out nearly all those living on Earth's colonies.

The Guardians of the Galaxy would form and eventually expel the Badoon from Earth, giving those left behind a chance to rebuild human civilization. Due to it's close history and definitive separation point, the Earth-691 reality expands on many popular characters and events with standard Marvel continuity.

Earth-58163 ( House of M)

This reality is where the House of M storyline took place, in a world where Homo Superior reigned supreme and it was the Homo Sapiens that were considered inferior.

This change of status quo began in 1979 when Magneto was attacked by Sentinels above Manhattan. As the fight came to an end, Magneto revealed an international conspiracy against mutants, involving Richard Nixon. So it was that Magneto was granted sovereignty over Genosha, and became the leader of the world's mutants.

Because of this, the most important laws became those that protected the lives of mutants. Examples of this was that performing stem cell research with mutant embryos was prohibited while using altered human embryos was allowed. This is how the racism became quite opposite, in that Sapiens were the outcasts in society and mutants held all great positions of power. Though some humans were given privileges the majority of Sapiens were rejected by society.

This reality is first made known to residents of Earth-616 when the X-Men and Avengers plot to kill Wanda Maximoff because of the dangers of her insanity. So it is that back at Genosha, the Maximoff family unites ( Magneto, Quicksilver and the Scarlet Witch).

So the heroes return to Genosha to find all of them missing and slowly, one by one, they are all engulfed by a white light...and transported to the "House of M" reality, officially known as Earth-58163.

It seems in this reality, Wanda has granted everyone their desires so that they can be truly happy. And none of the Earth-616 natives remember this, except for Wolverine of course who has his memory completely restored.

The key to saving all those who have fallen prey to Wanda is the mysterious young girl, Layla Miller who remembers everything and has the power to restore one's memory of their Earth-616 life.

So after she "awakens" more than a dozen heroes who are ready to bring the fight to Magneto, who at that moment ignores his daughter Polaris while mourning the loss of his good friend, Professor X.

While the team flies to Genosha in a helicarrier, they talk amongst each other about the upcoming fight and Jessica Drew brings up the fact that since they've all been given what they want, shouldn't they be content...but Wolverine ignores the thought.

The team arrives at Genosha and a battle ensues between the House of Magnus and the mutant royalty that has come to Genosha to celebrate the triumph of Homo Superior versus the "awakened" heroes.

As the battle continues it seems that everyone is to meet their end here, but when Magneto learns the truth of the matter (that it was Pietro who had Wanda create this fantasy world) he began to unleash his fury upon everyone, especially his son.

Quicksilver is beaten to a bleeding mass, but the Scarlet Witch comes to his rescue and heals his body and becomes angry with her father and her next few words change Earth-616 so drastically that it would likely be best if it could be undone. She said, "We're freaks, mutants...you chose this over us and you ruined us...", then she whispers the words that caused M-Day, "Daddy...No More Mutants."

And Earth-58163 disappears yet again in a flash of white...

Characters/Places that take place outside of the numbered realm:

The Exiles operates in and outside of any reality. Their base, the Panoptichron, or the Crystal Palace as it's also called, is said to exist outside of time and space.

The M'Kraan Crystal which is a Nexus of Realities. The insides of the M'Kraan Crystal is also said to exist outside of time and space.
